name: The George Of Stamford

reviews.text: Stayed on a snowy Saturday. Everyone seemed a bit more relaxed-perhaps due to the weather-but my stay was that much better for it. I've been a few times and it can be a bit Grace Brothers meets Hiacynth Bucket which can sometimes be fun at others a bit wearisome...your experience all revolves around the staff and how busy they are.
reviews.title: Another stay

reviews.text: I do think the restaurant is a bit on the pricey side-it's fine, but prices are a bit steep.
reviews.title: Classic coaching inn still great to visit

reviews.text: This time the service was very friendly and fun and I had a nice time.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visiting for a business meeting I was charmed by the ancient building but blown away by the wonderful service. The tea was hot and strong, the cake was yummy and I only wish I could have stayed for lunch. The ladies was a sight to behold
reviews.title: 3/3 Rutland-shire (Lincolnshire)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night and I wish it had been more. We were upgraded when we arrived which was a lovely surprise. The room was very comfortable and well equipped and the nicest thing of all is that they brought us morning tea, so we did not have to struggle with kettles and teabags. I wish more hotels offered this service.
reviews.title: Garden room excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely 4 poster room overlooking the courtyard with fabulous bathroom. Linen, pillows, towels & bathrobes all great quality. Room service & morning tea & papers good & prompt. Excellent quality food in the formal dining room & tasty breakfast all in a beautiful old atmospheric building. Recommended.
reviews.title: Beautiful room in historic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the George 3 times now each time the service has been excellent.
reviews.title: Simply the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is fantastic always a treat as we enjoy good food,it is all good quality from breakfast lunch through to evening meal.we have tried many meals both in The Garden room also Oak panelled restaurant both are excellent however quite expensive.
reviews.title: Great dinner and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedrooms are beautiful we stayed in a four poster room last time it was such a lovely room we did not want to leave.We have also stayed in one of the standard rooms which was very comfortable also beautifully furnished.We intend to stay again in the near future.
reviews.title: supper at the george

reviews.text: This is a great place to stay for that special birthday or anniversary.
reviews.title: Great place. Some helpful observations.
Class.
reviews.text: The George is typical of Stamford itself: stylish, atmospheric and classy. I booked a single room, but - probably because not many guests were staying - I was upgraded to a double: hence "Very Good" for value.

reviews.title: Amazing weekend.
reviews.text: The whole place is immaculate, and the staff are down to earth, very nice and friendly. I had lunch in the York Bar, with dinner and breakfast in the Garden Lounge. All three meals were exceptional and at very reasonable cost.

reviews.title: A Lovely Hotel
reviews.text: My only gripe was that there was only a trickle of water coming out of the shower, and as the shower head is in a static position I had to stand on the curve of the bath to get under it. That could cause an accident.

reviews.title: Reviewed this magnificent hotel 2 years ago: Still a national institution
reviews.text: After coming here for many years I decided to treat my partner to a weekend away here. I told him how lovely it was and The George did not let me down. We arrived to a really warm welcome on the Friday night and were shown to a lovely room (15) it was really quiet and overlooked the courtyard. We dined in the oak restaurant on the Saturday night as part of the weekend break deal. The food was divine and the service superb. Was sad to leave on the Sunday morning and can not wait to go back again.

reviews.title: Warm Welcome
reviews.text: The George is a lovely, well located, hotel where staff provide great service. The rooms are very comfortable and well equipped. A morning paper and wi-fi are included in the room rate and free parking is readily available. The hotel could be even better there were tea and coffeee facilities available in the bedrooms or if room service for a simple cup of tea was not almost £4.
Coming up to double digits for staying at the George, having used the hotel both for conferences and personal trips. It seemed by the third trip a good number of staff could remember my name!
reviews.title: Business and Pleasure

reviews.text: The hotel is a bastion of charm and excellent service. Its not a modernist, trendy hotel, but it is amazing and oozes charm and quality. The service is impeccable, from the properly attired waiting staff to the fresh coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice delivered in the morning with your paper.
reviews.title: Cosy fire, welcoming hospitality, traditional service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing is too much trouble for the staff, who are always happy to help, be it bringing a drink in the expansive lounge with massive log fire to finding friends who are looking for your table.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Foodwise- the oak panelled restaurant (which is formal dining at its best), has really very good food. Might not be cutting edge fusion, but it is always truly excellent quality, with impeccable standards.
reviews.title: The best hotel for traditional english hospitality,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The garden room is much less formal, but serves a range of very tasty food, clearly all freshly prepared by well qualified kitchen staff.
reviews.title: The George - Fantatstic Hotel

description: The George of Stamford is one of England's greatest coaching inns. It retains the charm and atmosphere of its long history yet offers today's guests every modern comfort.
